intro: Acleisanthes obtusa, commonly known as the broadleaf morning glory, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Convolvulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that typically bloom in the morning. The plant has heart-shaped leaves and produces edible seeds, though caution is advised as some parts may be toxic. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in shaded or semi-shaded environments. Acleisanthes obtusa is valued for its ornamental beauty and historical use in traditional medicine.
